str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, subdue; pass: To be in danger of death, be dead to, be rid of, be parted from. From thanatos to kill.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From prasso; practice, i.e. an act; by extension, a function.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
